com.fasterxml.storemate.store.backend

Class StoreBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.backend.StoreBackend
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BDBJEStoreBackend, LevelDBStoreBackend

    public abstract class StoreBackend
extends Object
    Abstraction used by StorableStore for interacting with the underlying physical database.

      • start

                    throws Exception

        public abstract void prepareForStop()
                             throws Exception
        Throws:

      • stop

        public abstract void stop()
                   throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception

      • hasEfficientEntryCount

        public abstract boolean hasEfficientEntryCount()
        Method for checking whether link getEntryCount() has a method to produce entry count using a method that is more efficient than explicitly iterating over entries. Note that even if true is returned, some amount of iteration may be required, and operation may still be more expensive than per-entry access.

      • hasEfficientIndexCount

        public abstract boolean hasEfficientIndexCount()
        Method for checking whether link getIndexedCount() has a method to produce index entry count using a method that is more efficient than explicitly iterating over index entries. Note that even if true is returned, some amount of iteration may be required, and operation may still be more expensive than per-entry access.

      • getEntryStatistics

        public abstract Object getEntryStatistics(BackendStatsConfig config)
        Accessor for backend-specific statistics information regarding primary entry storage.
        Parameters:
        onlyFastStats - If true, will avoid obtaining most expensive statistics (and returning a subset of full stats); if false, will try to get all statistics backend exposes.
        -
        Since:
        0.9.7

      • getIndexStatistics

        public abstract Object getIndexStatistics(BackendStatsConfig config)
        Accessor for backend-specific statistics information regarding primary entry storage.
        Parameters:
        onlyFastStats - If true, will avoid obtaining most expensive statistics (and returning a subset of full stats); if false, will try to get all statistics backend exposes.
        Since:
        0.9.7

      • getStorableConverter

        public final StorableConverter getStorableConverter()

      • getEntryCount

        public abstract long getEntryCount()
        Accessor for getting approximate count of entries in the underlying main entry database, if (but only if) it can be accessed in constant time without actually iterating over data.

      • getIndexedCount

        public abstract long getIndexedCount()
        Accessor for getting approximate count of entries accessible via last-modifed index, if (but only if) it can be accessed in constant time without actually iterating over data.

      • countEntries

        public abstract long countEntries()
                           throws StoreException
        Method that will iterate over entries and produce exact count of entries. This should only be called from diagnostics systems, and typically only if getEntryCount() is not available (as per hasEfficientEntryCount()).
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • countIndexed

        public abstract long countIndexed()
                           throws StoreException
        Method that will iterate over entries and produce exact count of entries. This should only be called from diagnostics systems, and typically only if #getIndexCount is not available (as per hasEfficientIndexCount()).
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • hasEntry

        public abstract boolean hasEntry(StorableKey key)
                          throws StoreException
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • findEntry

        public abstract Storable findEntry(StorableKey key)
                            throws StoreException
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • scanEntries

        public abstract IterationResult scanEntries(StorableIterationCallback cb)
                                     throws StoreException
        Method for scanning potentially all the entries in the store, in the fastest iteration order (usually derived from physical storage ordering).

        Note that iteration is not transactional, in that operations may modify entries during iteration process.

        Returns:
        True if iteration completed succesfully; false if it was terminated
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • iterateEntriesByKey

        public IterationResult iterateEntriesByKey(StorableIterationCallback cb)
                                    throws StoreException
        Method for scanning potentially all the entries in the store, ordered by the primary key.

        Note that iteration is not transactional, in that operations may modify entries during iteration process.

        Parameters:
        cb - Callback used for actual iteration
        Returns:
        True if iteration completed successfully; false if it was terminated
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • iterateEntriesByKey

        public abstract IterationResult iterateEntriesByKey(StorableIterationCallback cb,
                                  StorableKey firstKey)
                                             throws StoreException
        Method for scanning potentially all the entries in the store, ordered by the primary key.

        Note that iteration is not transactional, in that operations may modify entries during iteration process.

        Parameters:
        cb - Callback used for actual iteration
        firstKey - (optional) If not null, key for the first entry to include (inclusive); if null, starts from the very first entry
        Returns:
        True if iteration completed successfully; false if it was terminated
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • iterateEntriesAfterKey

        public abstract IterationResult iterateEntriesAfterKey(StorableIterationCallback cb,
                                     StorableKey lastSeen)
                                                throws StoreException
        Method for scanning potentially all the entries in the store, ordered by the primary key, starting with entry after specified key

        Throws:
        StoreException
        Since:
        0.8.8

      • iterateEntriesByModifiedTime

        public IterationResult iterateEntriesByModifiedTime(StorableLastModIterationCallback cb)
                                             throws StoreException
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • iterateEntriesByModifiedTime

        public abstract IterationResult iterateEntriesByModifiedTime(StorableLastModIterationCallback cb,
                                           long firstTimestamp)
                                                      throws StoreException
        Method for scanning potentially all the entries in the store, ordered by the last-modified order (from oldest to newest)

        Note that iteration is not transactional, in that operations may modify entries during iteration process.

        Parameters:
        cb - Callback used for actual iteration
        firstTimestamp - (optional) Key for the first entry to include (inclusive); if null, starts from the very first entry
        Returns:
        True if iteration completed successfully; false if it was terminated
        Throws:
        StoreException

      • createEntry

        public abstract Storable createEntry(StorableKey key,
                   Storable storable)
                              throws IOException,
                                     StoreException
        Method that tries to create specified entry in the database, if (and only if!) no entry exists for given key. If an entry exists, it will be returned and no changes are made.
        Returns:
        Null if creation succeeded; or existing entry if not
        Throws:
        IOException
        StoreException

      • putEntry

        public abstract Storable putEntry(StorableKey key,
                Storable storable)
                           throws IOException,
                                  StoreException
        Method that inserts given entry in the database, possibly replacing an existing version; also returns the old entry.
        Returns:
        Existing entry, if any
        Throws:
        IOException
        StoreException

      • ovewriteEntry

        public abstract void ovewriteEntry(StorableKey key,
                 Storable storable)
                            throws IOException,
                                   StoreException
        Method that forcibly inserts or ovewrites entry for given key, without trying to read possibly existing version. Should only be used when modifications are made from an atomic operation (to avoid race conditions).
        Throws:
        IOException
        StoreException

      • upsertEntry

        public abstract boolean upsertEntry(StorableKey key,
                  Storable storable,
                  OverwriteChecker checker,
                  AtomicReference<Storable> oldEntryRef)
                             throws IOException,
                                    StoreException
        Method that may insert (if no entry with given key exists) or try to overwrite an entry with given key; but overwrite only happens if given 'checker' object allows overwrite. It should only be called if overwrite is truly conditional; otherwise other methods (like putEntry(com.fasterxml.storemate.shared.StorableKey, com.fasterxml.storemate.store.Storable)} or ovewriteEntry(StorableKey, Storable)) are more efficient.
        Parameters:
        oldEntryRef - If not null, existing entry will be returned via this object
        Returns:
        True if entry was created or updated; false if not (an old entry exists, and checker did not allow overwrite)
        Throws:
        IOException
        StoreException
        Since:
        0.9.3

      • deleteEntry

        public abstract boolean deleteEntry(StorableKey key)
                             throws IOException,
                                    StoreException
        Method called to physically delete entry for given key, if one exists.
        Returns:
        False if deletion was not done because no such entry was found; true if deletion succeeeded
        Throws:
        StoreException - If deletion failed to due to backend-specific problem
        IOException - If deletion failed due to underlying I/O problem, exposed by store (not all stores expose them)
